intro: Pentagonia osaensis, commonly known as the Osa Peninsula pentagonia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Osa Peninsula in Costa Rica. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive pentagonal shape in its flower structure. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. It has small, hairy leaves and produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom during the wet season. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of particular interest to botanists and conservationists.
